30#include <sys/cdefs.h>
31__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: i915_gem_render_state.c,v 1.9 2018/08/27 14:50:04 riastradh Exp $");
32
33#include "i915_drv.h"
34#include "intel_renderstate.h"
35
36static const struct intel_renderstate_rodata *
37render_state_get_rodata(struct drm_device *dev, const int gen)
38{
39 switch (gen) {
40 case 6:
41 return &gen6_null_state;
42 case 7:
43 return &gen7_null_state;
44 case 8:
45 return &gen8_null_state;
46 case 9:
47 return &gen9_null_state;
48 }
49
50 return NULL;
51}
52
53static int render_state_init(struct render_state *so, struct drm_device *dev)
54{
55 int ret;
56
57 so->gen = INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen;
58 so->rodata = render_state_get_rodata(dev, so->gen);
59 if (so->rodata == NULL)
60 return 0;
61
62 if (so->rodata->batch_items * 4 > 4096)
63 return -EINVAL;
64
65 so->obj = i915_gem_alloc_object(dev, 4096);
66 if (so->obj == NULL)
67 return -ENOMEM;
68
69 ret = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_pin(so->obj, 4096, 0);
70 if (ret)
71 goto free_gem;
72
73 so->ggtt_offset = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(so->obj);
74 return 0;
75
76free_gem:
77 drm_gem_object_unreference(&so->obj->base);
78 return ret;
79}
80
81/*
82 * Macro to add commands to auxiliary batch.
83 * This macro only checks for page overflow before inserting the commands,
84 * this is sufficient as the null state generator makes the final batch
85 * with two passes to build command and state separately. At this point
86 * the size of both are known and it compacts them by relocating the state
87 * right after the commands taking care of aligment so we should sufficient
88 * space below them for adding new commands.
89 */
90#define OUT_BATCH(batch, i, val) \
91 do { \
92 if (WARN_ON((i) >= PAGE_SIZE / sizeof(u32))) { \
93 ret = -ENOSPC; \
94 goto err_out; \
95 } \
96 (batch)[(i)++] = (val); \
97 } while(0)
98
99static int render_state_setup(struct render_state *so)
100{
101 const struct intel_renderstate_rodata *rodata = so->rodata;
102 unsigned int i = 0, reloc_index = 0;
103#ifdef __NetBSD__
104 vaddr_t kva;
105#else
106 struct page *page;
107#endif
108 u32 *d;
109 int ret;
110
111 ret = i915_gem_object_set_to_cpu_domain(so->obj, true);
112 if (ret)
113 return ret;
114
115#ifdef __NetBSD__
116 CTASSERT(PAGE_SIZE == 4096);
117 /* Acquire a reference for uvm_map to consume. */
118 uao_reference(so->obj->base.filp);
119 kva = 0; /* hint */
120 /* XXX errno NetBSD->Linux */
121 ret = -uvm_map(kernel_map, &kva, PAGE_SIZE, so->obj->base.filp, 0,
122 sizeof(*d), UVM_MAPFLAG(UVM_PROT_W, UVM_PROT_W, UVM_INH_NONE,
123 UVM_ADV_NORMAL, 0));
124 if (ret) {
125 uao_detach(so->obj->base.filp);
126 return ret;
127 }
128 d = (void *)kva;
129#else
130 page = sg_page(so->obj->pages->sgl);
131 d = kmap(page);
132#endif
133
134 while (i < rodata->batch_items) {
135 u32 s = rodata->batch[i];
136
137 if (i * 4 == rodata->reloc[reloc_index]) {
138 u64 r = s + so->ggtt_offset;
139 s = lower_32_bits(r);
140 if (so->gen >= 8) {
141 if (i + 1 >= rodata->batch_items ||
142 rodata->batch[i + 1] != 0) {
143 ret = -EINVAL;
144 goto err_out;
145 }
146
147 d[i++] = s;
148 s = upper_32_bits(r);
149 }
150
151 reloc_index++;
152 }
153
154 d[i++] = s;
155 }
156
157 while (i % CACHELINE_DWORDS)
158 OUT_BATCH(d, i, MI_NOOP);
159
160 so->aux_batch_offset = i * sizeof(u32);
161
162 OUT_BATCH(d, i, MI_BATCH_BUFFER_END);
163 so->aux_batch_size = (i * sizeof(u32)) - so->aux_batch_offset;
164
165 /*
166 * Since we are sending length, we need to strictly conform to
167 * all requirements. For Gen2 this must be a multiple of 8.
168 */
169#ifdef __NetBSD__ /* XXX ALIGN means something else. */
170 so->aux_batch_size = round_up(so->aux_batch_size, 8);
171#else
172 so->aux_batch_size = ALIGN(so->aux_batch_size, 8);
173#endif
174
175#ifdef __NetBSD__
176 uvm_unmap(kernel_map, kva, kva + PAGE_SIZE);
177#else
178 kunmap(page);
179#endif
180
181 ret = i915_gem_object_set_to_gtt_domain(so->obj, false);
182 if (ret)
183 return ret;
184
185 if (rodata->reloc[reloc_index] != -1) {
186 DRM_ERROR("only %d relocs resolved\n", reloc_index);
187 return -EINVAL;
188 }
189
190 return 0;
191
192err_out:
193#ifdef __NetBSD__
194 uvm_unmap(kernel_map, kva, kva + PAGE_SIZE);
195#else
196 kunmap(page);
197#endif
198 return ret;
199}
200
201#undef OUT_BATCH
202
203void i915_gem_render_state_fini(struct render_state *so)
204{
205 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(so->obj);
206 drm_gem_object_unreference(&so->obj->base);
207}
208
209int i915_gem_render_state_prepare(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
210 struct render_state *so)
211{
212 int ret;
213
214 if (WARN_ON(ring->id != RCS))
215 return -ENOENT;
216
217 ret = render_state_init(so, ring->dev);
218 if (ret)
219 return ret;
220
221 if (so->rodata == NULL)
222 return 0;
223
224 ret = render_state_setup(so);
225 if (ret) {
226 i915_gem_render_state_fini(so);
227 return ret;
228 }
229
230 return 0;
231}
232
233int i915_gem_render_state_init(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
234{
235 struct render_state so;
236 int ret;
237
238 ret = i915_gem_render_state_prepare(req->ring, &so);
239 if (ret)
240 return ret;
241
242 if (so.rodata == NULL)
243 return 0;
244
245 ret = req->ring->dispatch_execbuffer(req, so.ggtt_offset,
246 so.rodata->batch_items * 4,
247 I915_DISPATCH_SECURE);
248 if (ret)
249 goto out;
250
251 if (so.aux_batch_size > 8) {
252 ret = req->ring->dispatch_execbuffer(req,
253 (so.ggtt_offset +
254 so.aux_batch_offset),
255 so.aux_batch_size,
256 I915_DISPATCH_SECURE);
257 if (ret)
258 goto out;
259 }
260
261 i915_vma_move_to_active(i915_gem_obj_to_ggtt(so.obj), req);
262
263out:
264 i915_gem_render_state_fini(&so);
265 return ret;
266}
